whoAmI: A honed software engineer who loves solving problems in either Web or Desktop development. Specialized in enterprise application development.

techStacks.name: JavaScript
techStacks.funFact: JavaScript was created in just 10 days by Brendan Eich at Netscape in 1995 and was originally called "Mocha" before becoming LiveScript, then JavaScript.

techStacks.name: Vue.js
techStacks.funFact: Vue.js was built by former Google engineer Evan You, and its name stands for “view” — highlighting its core focus on the view layer of applications.

techStacks.name: C#
techStacks.funFact: The name C# comes from musical notation, where a “sharp” indicates that the written note should be made a semitone higher in pitch — implying an evolution of C and C++.

techStacks.name: Java
techStacks.funFact: Java was originally called Oak after an oak tree outside the creator’s window; it was later renamed Java after Java coffee to reflect its fast, dynamic nature.

techStacks.name: React
techStacks.funFact: React introduced the virtual DOM concept when Facebook open-sourced it in 2013, revolutionizing how UIs update efficiently.

techStacks.name: Astro
techStacks.funFact: Astro was created by Fred K. Schott and contributors as a modern static site builder that uses Island Architecture to deliver zero JavaScript by default—making sites up to 40% faster with 90% less JavaScript compared to a typical React setup. This site is also using Astro for fun fact :D

techStacks.name: Angular
techStacks.funFact: Angular’s angle-bracket logo was chosen as a nod to HTML’s angled tags, and the framework itself is a complete rewrite of the original AngularJS.

techStacks.name: HTML
techStacks.funFact: HTML was invented by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991 to create the very first web page — an online guide to the World Wide Web itself.

techStacks.name: CSS
techStacks.funFact: The “Cascading” in CSS refers to the way style rules cascade and inherit — a concept designed by Håkon Wium Lie in 1996 to separate content from presentation.

techStacks.name: Git
techStacks.funFact: Linus Torvalds created Git in 2005 for Linux kernel development; its name is British slang for “unpleasant person,” chosen as a lighthearted jab.

techStacks.name: Python
techStacks.funFact: Python’s name is a tribute to the British comedy troupe Monty Python, reflecting Guido van Rossum’s goal of making programming fun.

techStacks.name: SQL
techStacks.funFact: SQL was originally called SEQUEL (Structured English Query Language) when developed at IBM in the 1970s before being shortened to SQL.
